Media.MediaTitle: esophageal squamous cell carcinoma stage IIIA

ImageData.LabelName: Stage IIIA Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Esophagus
Cancer in 3 to 6 lymph nodes near tumor
Cancer in 1 to 2 lymph nodes near tumor

OriginalSource.Creator: Terese Winslow
OriginalSource.Comment: Revised the alignment of the two labels on the bottom
Revisions made to image per AJCC 8th edition staging

Changed brackets to curly brackets with the label line pointing to the middle of the bracket; added label for Submucosa, pointing to the white band near the top, and made the mucosa layer just include the layers from the top of the submucosa to the top of the image; and made the connective tissue layer at the very bottom a little thicker
Removed the label and bracket on the main figure that says "Lower esophagus"; moved the cut out part to the middle of the esophagus; and added the label "Esophagus"

Added a (1) after the image title; showed the body in the main figure with just the labels "Lower esophagus" and "Stomach" and the two inset panels with the cancer spots; in the first panel, took the cancer out of the muscle layer and made it extend down to the bottom of the mucosal layer; moved the label "OR" down between the two panels so that it lines up with the mucosal layer

ContentDescriptions.ContentDescription: Stage IIIA squamous cell carcinoma of the esophagus; drawing shows the esophagus and stomach. A two-panel inset shows the layers of the esophagus wall: the mucosa layer, thin muscle layer, submucosa layer, thick muscle layer, and connective tissue layer. The left panel shows cancer in the mucosa layer, thin muscle layer, and submucosa layer and in 3 lymph nodes near the tumor. The right panel shows cancer in the mucosa layer, thin muscle layer, submucosa layer, and thick muscle layer and in 1 lymph node near the tumor.

Stage IIIA squamous cell carcinoma of the esophagus; drawing shows the esophagus and stomach. A two-panel inset shows the layers of the esophagus wall: the mucosa layer, thin muscle layer, submucosa layer, thick muscle layer, and connective tissue layer. The left panel shows cancer in the mucosa layer, thin muscle layer, and submucosa layer and in 3 lymph nodes near the tumor. The right panel shows cancer in the mucosa layer, thin muscle layer, submucosa layer, and thick muscle layer and in 1 lymph node near the tumor.

Captions.MediaCaption: Stage IIIA squamous cell carcinoma of the esophagus. Cancer has spread into the mucosa layer, thin muscle layer, or submucosa layer of the esophagus wall. Cancer is found in 3 to 6 lymph nodes near the tumor; OR cancer has spread into the thick muscle layer of the esophagus wall. Cancer is found in 1 to 2 lymph nodes near the tumor.

Stage IIIA squamous cell carcinoma of the esophagus. Cancer has spread into the mucosa layer, thin muscle layer, or submucosa layer of the esophagus wall. Cancer is found in 3 to 6 lymph nodes near the tumor; OR cancer has spread into the thick muscle layer of the esophagus wall. Cancer is found in 1 to 2 lymph nodes near the tumor.

ProposedUse.Glossary: stage III esophageal squamous cell carcinoma
